Articles.Content: Please help me I need a challenge. So I am currently have no ideas of what to do in KSP anymore. Can someone please give me a challenge!

See how many times you can go to orbit and back in a vehicle that weighs under 100 tonnes.

Staging encouraged, of course -- just don't refuel.
Do one of the challenges or a career, but in RSS (or via a rescaling mod), keeping the parts limited to stock physics (so no mods like SMURFF or RO).

Here's an Idea... Colonize the Entire System with a complex colony using only Stock part with TAC LS or Kerbalism....

Enjoy the challenge

Ok, does sending a probe count?

I know that isn’t colonizing but I am landing something on a planet.
Until you start playing with mods that add life-support requirements, it's just 'Practice Mode'.

A very good challenge from this forum:

You can choose your own level of difficulty, or do what I did and complete all levels in a single flight.

If you want even more of a challenge, do a mission from Kerbin's seafloor to Eve's seafloor and back.

On 6/19/2020 at 12:22 AM, Little Kerbonaut! said:

Please help me I need a challenge. So I am currently have no ideas of what to do in KSP anymore. Can someone please give me a challenge!

Go to a place you never had been before (If you haven't visited all the bodies), or if you have, install an interesting planet pack like GPP or JNSQ.
Launch an airplane at midnight, and land it on the crater rim before the sun sets there.

On 6/18/2020 at 11:22 PM, Little Kerbonaut! said:

Please help me I need a challenge. So I am currently have no ideas of what to do in KSP anymore. Can someone please give me a challenge!

I am doing a solar powered electric plane circumnavigation of Kerbin - with NO mods. Talk about a challenge...

as a long term plan i want to make a huge spaceship that can complete any mission without any external assistance. it can move anywhere in the kerbol system (at least 5000 m/s of deltaV with all tanks full, without counting the landers; though i may have to reduce that requirement a bit), it can drop an isru complex to refuel itself on any planet's SoI, and it can also drop a rover on the surface of any planet and get it back, all SSTO (not sure it is possible for eve, i may have to ditch that part of the plan; but definitely can SSTO a rover on kerbin).

for me it's a very long term project, something to do after i've done everything else. but you may want to try that too.

On 6/20/2020 at 6:30 PM, Castille7 said:

Build a Submarine!

I tried to do that but even with ore tanks filled up all the way it still just ended up floating.

Edited June 22, 2020 by Little Kerbonaut!
Give Kerbin fast internet (That's basically all my missions)
